item.title: Jane add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Jane add a quote by George Borrow
item.description: "Translation is at best an echo." -- George Borrow

item.title: Jane add a quote by Matthew Battles
item.description: "Andras Riedlmayer described a colleague who survived the siege of Sarajevo. In the winter, the scholar and his wife ran out of firewood, and so began to burn their books for heat and cooking. 'This forces one to think critically,' Riedlmayer remembered his friend saying. 'One must prioritize. First you burn old college textbooks, which you haven't read in thirty years. Then there are the duplicates. But eventually, you're forced to make tougher choices. Who burns today: Dostoevsky or Proust?' I asked Riedlmayer if his friend had any books left when the war was over. 'Oh yes,' he replied, his face lit by a flickering smile. 'He still had many books. Sometimes, he told me, you look at the books and just choose to go hungry." -- Matthew Battles

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jaroslav Pelikan
item.description: "Tradition is the living faith of the dead, traditionalism is the dead faith of the living. And, I suppose I should add, it is traditionalism that gives tradition such a bad name." -- Jaroslav Pelikan
